decks.notes: This deck focuses on aggressively deploying creatures and using burn spells to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and versatile removal spells, while also having some disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistent color access and a mix of dual lands to support the aggressive color requirements of the deck. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game.

This deck utilizes a combination of instant reanimation spells such as Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate along with creatures like Atraxa and Griselbrand to quickly put powerful threats onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Tainted Indulgence to support the reanimation strategy. It has a strong control element with cards like Solitude and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. The Leyline Binding helps to control the opponent's board, allowing the deck to focus on its game plan of quickly reanimating creatures for a powerful offensive.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures with abilities that trigger on death to create a toolbox of options for various situations. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can search for specific creatures to deal with threats or advance its combo pieces. Yawgmoth, Thran Physician acts as a centerpiece for sacrificing creatures to draw cards and control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a blend of creature recursion, removal, and combo potential.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones using Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to create explosive combos. Leyline Binding and Psychic Frog provide control elements, while Tainted Indulgence allows for card draw and disruption. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as a versatile threat, while Solitude and Force of Negation offer protection. Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's diverse requirements. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disrupting their strategies.

This deck focuses on maximizing the power of +1/+1 counters by utilizing cards like Hardened Scales and Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp. It aims to quickly build up a board presence with creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista, while also using cards like Steel Overseer to further enhance their abilities. With strong synergy between its various components, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with its aggro strategy, overwhelming them with powerful creatures and counters. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and Mox Opal provide additional support and mana ramp to ensure a fast and aggressive gameplay style.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Tameshi, Reality Architect and Hydroelectric Specimen to generate mana and eventually win the game with Goblin Charbelcher. It utilizes disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Whir of Invention to control the game and protect its combo pieces. The deck also includes ways to draw cards and counter spells to stay ahead of the opponent. Without relying on lands, this deck aims to quickly set up its win condition and overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using spells like Thought Scour and Chart a Course, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with cards like Persist and Unearth. It also includes disruptive spells like Counterspell and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board. The key strategy is to reanimate big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck has a good balance of card advantage, disruption, and powerful threats to outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The Leyline cards and Leyline Binding help to protect these creatures and keep them on the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Counterspells to control the game and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. The mana base is designed to provide a consistent source of all the colors needed for the spells and creatures in the deck.

This deck focuses on early aggression and utilizing powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining efficient creatures like Scion of Draco and Wild Nacatl with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to control the board and protect key creatures, while cards like Stubborn Denial provide additional protection and disruption. With a mix of creatures and spells from multiple colors, this deck aims to maintain a high level of aggression while maintaining versatility and flexibility.

This deck revolves around efficiently ramping up mana to bring out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan and utilize land tutors like Scapeshift to quickly assemble a lethal combination of lands to overwhelm the opponent. The key synergy lies in utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands, allowing for explosive plays with multiple land drops and triggers. The deck also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to further enhance the combo potential and ensure consistent and powerful plays throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride, supported by cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells like Galvanic Discharge. Blood Moon and Static Prison help disrupt the opponent's mana base and strategy, while Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach. The deck also includes cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for added versatility and power. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful Elemental creatures that generate value as they enter the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Solitude, Wrenn and Six, and Risen Reef, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The combination of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats makes it difficult for the opponent to gain traction, allowing the player to take control of the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures and control elements to disrupt your opponent's game plan while ramping up to play big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The UrzaTron lands help generate a lot of mana quickly, allowing you to cast your high-cost spells ahead of schedule. Karn, the Great Creator is a key card in the deck, providing utility and disruption with his abilities. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue your opponent with big, hard-to-deal-with threats.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through the UrzaTron lands and using control elements such as Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt the opponent's plans. It aims to stall the game with powerful threats like Sire of Seven Deaths and Thought-Knot Seer until it can overwhelm the opponent with high-impact creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny. The deck's key strategy is to establish board control and gradually increase pressure on the opponent, ultimately leading to a victorious endgame.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying Arclight Phoenixes by cycling through cards and utilizing cheap spells, while also using aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to cast multiple spells in a turn, triggering the Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, and burn the opponent out with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The inclusion of cards like Underworld Breach and Mishra's Bauble allows for additional card advantage and graveyard interaction, giving the deck both speed and consistent threats.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Underworld Breach combo using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and dig for combo pieces. Grinding Station acts as a win condition with Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal providing additional combo pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thassa's Oracle and Nameless Inversion to help control the game until the combo can be assembled. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and card advantage while the mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility.

The main idea of the deck is to control the opponent's plays using a combination of counter spells and removal, while ramping up mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove. Once enough mana is generated, the goal is to play Scapeshift to fetch multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and trigger their ability to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also has a toolbox approach thanks to cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Bring to Light, allowing for flexibility in responses to the opponent's threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent using the Cascade mechanic. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Ardent Plea to cascade into spells like Crashing Footfalls and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the board and protect its own strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures and powerful spells, this deck aims to win fast and decisively.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells with cascade abilities to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent and Ardent Plea to cascade into spells like Crashing Footfalls and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to support the aggressive strategy by providing additional value and disruption. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands to cascade into, the deck aims to maintain a consistent and aggressive gameplay throughout the match.

The primary goal of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by efficiently countering spells and removing threats with removal spells such as Fatal Push. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through card draw effects and graveyard recursion, using cards like Thought Scour and Unearth. By utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and take control of the game, eventually closing out the game with a powerful finisher such as Murktide Regent.

This Mardu Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Seasoned Pyromancer to create a fast and aggressive board presence, combined with removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's board, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The addition of cards like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment provide extra control options, while cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer additional threats for the opponent to deal with.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear alongside efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for casting spells, while cards like Searing Blaze and Skullcrack provide additional removal and disruption. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for quick deployment of threats and spells.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with low-cost spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Unholy Heat to target the opponent or their creatures while also generating card advantage through Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The creatures in the deck, such as Soul-Scar Mage, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Monastery Swiftspear, are designed to efficiently attack and pressure the opponent. The deck's mana base includes fetch lands to ensure consistent mana access for casting spells.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Narset, Parter of Veils. Temporary Lockdown and Suppression Ray help to keep the opponent's creatures in check, while Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats. The companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds an additional synergy to the deck. Overall, the key strategy is to control the game until victory is secured.
